column4: Can somebody help me? I've just installed ubuntu and going to install restricted drivers to enable nvidia gpu, how do i do this?
﻿Can somebody help me? I've just installed ubuntu and going to install restricted drivers to enable nvidia gpu, how do i do this?
test
Can somebody help me? I've just installed ubuntu and going to install restricted drivers to enable nvidia gpu, how the f*** do i do this?
test
go to system>administration>hardware drivers check box next to enabled
system>administration>synaptic>download from
system>administration>synaptic>download from then pick a server or choose other and then click button for best server and it will find fastest sever for your area
﻿How do I change the server which ubuntu searches for updates?
system>administration>synaptic>download from then pick a server or choose other and then click button for best server and it will find fastest sever for your area
it uses same server for updates
i've already tried that, it's really slow. I have a server local server address. how do i change it so that ubuntu searches from the custom server address that is'nt on the default list?
did you try Best Server button and let it test for fastest server?
yes, it said that it couldn't locate the best for me; i have a local address that i tested that works, how do i change it to this?
oh i see what you mean. gksu gedit /etc/apt/sources.list. try adding it there
what should i edit?
what should i edit in the sources.list file?
what is the address of the custom server you want to use?
i'm going to use this server: http://dl2.foss-id.web.id/ubuntu/dists/
you would have to replace all the http: addresses that are in your sources list with the custom address you want to use. i would backup the old one first though
thank you very much, it worked :-)
